alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 05 at 10:35AM CDT until August 07 at 5:36PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri... Big River at Byrnesville. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 24 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big River at Byrnesville. * WHEN...Until Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 19.3 feet, South Byrnesville Road goes under water near this level. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 19.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 16.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM CDT Saturday was 19.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.7 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7:00 am) Location Stg Stage Sun Mon Tue Wed Thu Big River Byrnesville 16.0 19.5 17.9 12.3 8.2 6.8 6.3 &&
info.instruction: Rainfall heavier than forecast could cause river levels to rise even higher than predicted. The National Weather Service will monitor this developing situation and issue follow up statements as conditions change. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
